DataElement.preferredDefinition: Death certificate identification number as assigned by the vital statistics office in the place recorded in Place of Death [1940].

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Death certificate identification number as assigned by the vital statistics office.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:The ethical principle or legal right that a physician or other health professional will hold secret all information relating to a patient, unless the patient gives consent permitting disclosure.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Treatment of information so that it is not divulged in ways that are inconsistent with the understanding of the original disclosure. Particularly, the ethical principle or legal right that a physician or other health professional will hold secret all information relating to a patient, unless the patient gives consent permitting disclosure.

Property.preferredDefinition: form signed by the attending physician indicating an individual's time and cause of death.

Concepts.definition: form signed by the attending physician indicating an individual's time and cause of death.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: form signed by the attending physician indicating an individual's time and cause of death._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: form signed by the attending physician indicating an individual's time and cause of death.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: form signed by the attending physician indicating an individual's time and cause of death.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
